idAbs.para: Creates a new version in the specified geodatabase.

summary.para: Creates a new version in the specified geodatabase.

pythonReference.para: The ArcSDE geodatabase that contains the parent version and will contain the new version. The default is to use the workspace defined in the environment settings.

dialogReference.para: The ArcSDE geodatabase that contains the parent version and will contain the new version. The default is to use the workspace defined in the environment settings.

pythonReference.para: The geodatabase, or version of a geodatabase, on which the new version will be based.

dialogReference.para: The geodatabase, or version of a geodatabase, on which the new version will be based.

pythonReference.para: The name of the version to be created.

dialogReference.para: The name of the version to be created.

pythonReference.para: The permission access level for the version.

dialogReference.para: The permission access level for the version.

bullet_item.para: The output version name is prefixed by the SDE geodatabase user nameâ€”for example, SDE.arctoolbox.
The output version's permissions are set to private by default but can be changed using the tool.
Personal and File geodatabases do not support versioning. Versioning tools only work with ArcSDE geodatabases.
Versions are not affected by changes occurring in other versions of the database.
A version's permission can only be changed by its owner (the user who created it).

scriptExample.para: The following stand-alone script demonstrates how to create a new version.
scriptExample.code:
# Name: CreateVersion_Example.py # Description: Creates a new version # Author: ESRI
# Import system modules import arcpy
# Set local variables inWorkspace = "Database Connections/ninefour@gdb.sde" parentVersion = "dbo.DEFAULT" versionName = "myVersion"
# Execute CreateVersion arcpy.CreateVersion_management(inWorkspace, parentVersion, versionName, "PUBLIC")
